overview: From 2025-11-01 to 2025-12-01, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (1 merged), 4 new issues, and 5 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: implement entity-level row level security
topPRs.author: standujar

topPRs.title: fix: agent settings persistence across restarts
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

Fixes agent settings not persisting across restarts, causing runtime-generated configuration to be lost.

# Risks

**Low risk**

- Changes core runtime initialization logic for agent settings merge
- All existing tests pass, new comprehensive test suite added
- Affects: Agent settings persistence, character configuration loading

# Background

## What does this PR do?

Fixes agent settings persistence by implementing intelligent merge between database-persisted settings and character file configuration during agent initialization.

**Before**: Settings saved at runtime (via `runtime.setSetting()` and `runtime.updateAgent()`) were lost on agent restart.

**After**: Settings are properly merged, preserving runtime state while allowing character file to override specific values.

## What kind of change is this?

Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. Review `packages/core/src/runtime.ts` changes in `ensureAgentExists()` (lines 2376-2442) and `initialize()` (lines 425-455)
2. Review comprehensive test suite in `packages/core/src/__tests__/ensure-agent-exists.test.ts`

## Detailed testing steps

**Automated tests:**
```bash
cd packages/core
bun test src/__tests__/ensure-agent-exists.test.ts
bun test src/__tests__/runtime.test.ts
```

**Manual integration test:**
1. Start agent with fresh character file (no runtime settings)
2. Use `runtime.setSetting()` to add configuration at runtime
3. Call `runtime.updateAgent()` to persist to database
4. Restart agent
5. Verify settings are loaded via `runtime.getSetting()`

**Test coverage:**
- ✅ New agent creation
- ✅ Settings merge on restart (DB + character file)
- ✅ Character file overrides DB values (same key)
- ✅ Deep merge of secrets
- ✅ Handles missing settings in DB
- ✅ Handles missing settings in character file
- ✅ Integration with `runtime.initialize()`
- ✅ `getSetting()` access to merged settings

All tests pass (9 tests, 28 assertions).

topPRs.title: feat: add ElizaOS reference to runtime
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
<!-- Use this template by filling in information and copying and pasting relevant items out of the HTML comments. -->

# Relates to

Relates to #6095 - Unified messaging API

# Risks

**Low risk**

This change is non-breaking and fully backward compatible:
- Adds optional `elizaOS?` property to runtime (existing code unaffected)
- Only affects plugins that explicitly use `runtime.elizaOS`
- Includes proper cleanup to prevent memory leaks
- Well-tested with plugin-discord integration

Potential areas affected:
- Runtime lifecycle (addition of ElizaOS reference)
- Memory management (cleanup in `stop()`)
- Plugin development patterns (new unified API access)

# Background

## What does this PR do?

This PR enables plugins to access the unified messaging API (`elizaOS.sendMessage()`) introduced in #6095 by adding an optional reference to the ElizaOS instance in the runtime.

**Key changes:**
- Created `IElizaOS` interface for clean abstraction
- Added `elizaOS?: IElizaOS` property to `IAgentRuntime`
- Added `hasElizaOS()` type guard helper
- ElizaOS auto-assigns itself to runtimes during registration
- Added cleanup in `runtime.stop()` to prevent memory leaks

**Benefits:**
- Plugins can now use `runtime.elizaOS.sendMessage()` for standardized messaging
- Type-safe access with `hasElizaOS()` guard
- Auto-filling, connection management, SYNC/ASYNC modes
- Clean architecture with no circular dependencies

## What kind of change is this?

- [x] Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [x] Improvements (misc. changes to existing features)

## Why are we doing this?

The unified messaging API (#6095) provides a standardized entry point for sending messages to agents, but plugins currently have no way to access it. They must use `messageService.handleMessage()` directly, which bypasses the benefits of the unified API (auto-filling, connection management, callbacks, etc.).

This PR solves that by giving the runtime a reference to its parent ElizaOS instance, allowing plugins to call `runtime.elizaOS.sendMessage()` when available, while maintaining a fallback for standalone mode.

# Documentation changes needed?

- [x] My changes require a change to the project documentation.
- [ ] If documentation change is needed: I have updated the documentation accordingly.

**Documentation needed:**
- Plugin development guide should mention `runtime.elizaOS.sendMessage()` API
- Example usage in plugin templates
- Migration guide for existing plugins (optional, recommended)

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. Review the architecture: `packages/core/src/types/elizaos.ts` - new interface
2. Check runtime changes: `packages/core/src/types/runtime.ts` and `packages/core/src/runtime.ts`
3. Verify ElizaOS auto-assignment: `packages/core/src/elizaos.ts` lines 158 and 203
4. Look at cleanup: `packages/core/src/runtime.ts` line 384

## Detailed testing steps

**Automated:**
- [x] TypeScript compilation passes
- [x] No circular dependencies
- [x] Type safety verified

**Manual testing (with plugin-discord):**
- [x] Runtime has `elizaOS` reference after initialization
- [x] `hasElizaOS()` returns `true` when ElizaOS is present
- [x] Plugins can call `runtime.elizaOS.sendMessage()` successfully
- [x] Fallback to `messageService.handleMessage()` works when ElizaOS is undefined
- [x] Memory cleanup on `runtime.stop()` works correctly

**Test with plugin-discord:**
```typescript
// In plugin-discord/src/messages.ts
if (this.runtime.hasElizaOS()) {
  // Uses unified API - confirmed via logs
  await this.runtime.elizaOS.sendMessage(agentId, message, options);
} else {
  // Fallback for standalone
  await this.runtime.messageService.handleMessage(runtime, message, callback);
}
```

Logs confirm unified API is used:
```
Info [Discord] Using unified messaging API
```

# Relates to

Fixes agent settings not persisting across restarts, causing runtime-generated configuration to be lost.

# Risks

**Low risk**

- Changes core runtime initialization logic for agent settings merge
- All existing test

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on significant feature development, opening a pull request to implement entity-level row level security in elizaos/eliza (#6107). This substantial work involved changes to 31 files and added over 1500 lines of code. All of their activity this month was concentrated on this single feature.

0xbbjoker: This month, 0xbbjoker focused on extending plugin functionality by opening a pull request to add text embedding model support to the OpenRouter plugin (elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter#17). This feature work involved changes across 9 files, including both application code and corresponding tests. The contribution demonstrates a clear focus on expanding feature capabilities within the plugin ecosystem.

wtfsayo: This month, wtfsayo focused on maintenance and refactoring within the `elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp` repository. Their sole merged pull request, #18, updated action names and dependencies, resulting in a significant code cleanup that removed over 400 lines. This work involved an even split of feature, bugfix, and other tasks, touching code, documentation, and configuration files.

ai16x402: This month, ai16x402 focused on expanding the plugin ecosystem by opening three pull requests in elizaos-plugins/registry (#239, #238, #237) to add new plugins. Their contributions consisted of 7 commits modifying configuration files to support these additions. They also left 3 comments on pull requests.
